title: [Large-Scale] Reteaching Design Strategies for Integrating Sleep and Technology-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental mathematics instruction skills and mastery of relearning principles
context.additional_context: Designed for elementary school teachers to improve math instruction techniques. Combines self-directed relearning using personal devices with group discussion sessions.

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically analyze and design a spaced-relearning plan aligned with sleep cycles.
Learners can quantitatively compare relearning effectiveness across three types of math problems (procedural, conceptual, and reasoning).
Learners can explain the impact of sleep-wake cycles on skill acquisition based on experimental data.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
